::Cledar/Forrior/Rixer/Blyer/Prowl/Firearm::

Cledar arms his weapon, walking down the corridor that IR ran into slowly, with his team following. After a few seconds, he realizes that his scanners couldn't detect her.

"Slag.. Rixer, stay here and get us more efficient scans as quick as you can. Blyer, Truttle, stay with him. Me and Forrior will go in, contact us when you get something."

He advances to the next hallway, seeing Hell Drak and Necromancer firing at something, then the cealing collapsing and a monster flying at them. He and Forrior instantly open fire, jumping into the hallway and rolling into a crouching position, their weapons set on stun, trying not to breathe in the green stuff that was coming out of the broken door.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Rixer and Blyer stop, Rixer looking over at the nearest busted-up console and pulling out a few pieces from it. He kneels down at begins to improve his already advanced scaners, Cledar not having told him that they were no longer neccessary. Blyer stands watch.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Already in the air, Prowl flies above the ship, trying to detect as much as he could with his mind. He knew he could use his and IR's mental link to locate her and find out her plan, but he doesn't cheat. Seeing a hole in the wall, he flies into it and lands in the ship, not too far from IR's position.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Firearm walks down the opposite corridor from the rest of the Maximals, putting his weapon on as weak a power as it could go and keeping his eyes out for Iron Raptor.



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * There was no way anyone could know exactly where she was in the 
> holoroom...unless they saw her right out and plain.
> But that was hard to do...when she was up in the roof.
> In a smaller form of her SBM, one where she had to travel on 4 legs instead 
> of two. It was easy going.
> But just to give a teaser to anyone that might be near...she peeked out and 
> looked around.
> Clear.
> Slipping from the roof she skittered down onto the floor and down the hall a 
> bit. Coming close to a large door with huge red letters that spelled: 
> RADIOACTIVE!*
